2.text: I have heard many such things: grievous comforters are ye all.

3.text: Shall words of wind have an end? or what provoketh thee that thou answerest?

4.text: I also could speak as ye: if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could join together words against you, and shake my head at you;

5.text: [But] I would encourage you with my mouth, and the solace of my lips should assuage [your pain].

6.text: If I speak, my pain is not assuaged; and if I forbear, what am I eased?

7.text: But now he hath made me weary;... thou hast made desolate all my family;

8.text: Thou hast shrivelled me up! it is become a witness; and my leanness riseth up against me, it beareth witness to my face.

9.text: His anger teareth and pursueth me; he gnasheth with his teeth against me; [as] mine adversary he sharpeneth his eyes at me.

10.text: They gape upon me with their mouth; they smite my cheeks reproachfully; they range themselves together against me.

11.text: God hath delivered me over to the iniquitous man, and hurled me into the hands of the wicked.

12.text: I was at rest, but he hath shattered me; he hath taken me by the neck and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.

13.text: His arrows encompass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.

14.text: He breaketh me with breach upon breach; he runneth upon me like a mighty man.

15.text: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and rolled my horn in the dust.

16.text: My face is red with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;

17.text: Although there is no violence in my hands, and my prayer is pure.

18.text: O earth, cover not my blood, and let there be no place for my cry!

19.text: Even now, behold, my Witness is in the heavens, and he that voucheth for me is in the heights.

20.text: My friends are my mockers; mine eye poureth out tears unto +God.

21.text: Oh that there were arbitration for a man with +God, as a son of man for his friend!

22.text: For years [few] in number shall pass,—and I shall go the way [whence] I shall not return.
